alert.note: Alert for Logan; Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mingo and southwestern Logan Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 725 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Warfield to Turkey Creek to Canada. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamson, Delbarton, Holden, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Red Jacket, Chattaroy, Hinch, Buskirk, Oppy, Gilbert Creek, Matewan, Kermit, Verdunville, Myrtle, Pie, Naugatuck, Dingess, Varney, Sarah Ann and Meador. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
